intro: Orlaya daucorlaya, commonly known as the slender meadowfoam, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. Orlaya daucorlaya thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its delicate appearance and ecological importance make it a notable species in native plant gardens.
